utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My child has been having a sore throat and chills yesterday as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you mentioned the sore throat started three to four days ago and the chills started yesterday. And is he having any issues swallowing food or fluids?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it seems like appetite's gone down, like a lot of pain in his throat, especially when swallowing solid foods.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you taken a look into his throat? Is it red? Do you see any yellow streaking white stuff, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I definitely did take a look yesterday and definitely saw a lot of redness. I don't know if I saw any white or yellow streaks, but definitely looks very red in there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do his tonsils look enlarged?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, everything looks swollen in there, I don't know what's what, but it does look very angry in there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. And has he had a stuffy nose or runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any loss of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about changes in vision or hearing? Any changes in her nails or skin like rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no rashes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you taken his temperature at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I think he might have had a fever yesterday, but we didn't really take a temperature.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, any fatigue or exhaustion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Energy's pretty much the same, just really complaining a lot about the throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, have you noticed any swelling in in the neck area?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I think there might be like a few lumps near his neck, so I don't know if that's swelling, but definitely there is. There's a few that I felt over the last few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, coughing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, hasn't been coughing at all

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, and how about shortness of breath or wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Feeling like his heart is racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Swelling in his limbs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. I haven't noticed anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He was complaining of a headache a few days ago, but it kind of went away on its own.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So the headache's gone completely now.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have any confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Joint pain or muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about his bowel movements? Have those been normal?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, they've been normal. No diarrhea or constipation.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about in nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, he hasn't told me anything about that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any appetite changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, just with the trouble swallowing I'm trying to make sure that he gets like liquids because over the last few days he can't tolerate like solid foods at all.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, how about a weight loss over the past few weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. t's just been over the last few days that he hasn't been eating like himself.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright and has he been healthy otherwise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, otherwise he's a very healthy child. We have rarely gone to a doctor for him before, so yeah, nothing. Nothing else with him.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you tried anything for his sore throat? Anything over the counter?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: We did try, uh, like Tylenol cold. It helped with this headache, but it didn't really help with his sore throat

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and has he ever experienced anything like this in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any hospitalizations or surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any medications that he's on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no medication.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, is he up to date with all his immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, all his immunizations are up to date.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, family history of lung conditions or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no lung or heart conditions. His father does have diabetes though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how old was he when he was diagnosed with diabetes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think probably in his late 30s with type 2 diabetes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Type 2, OK and then any sick contacts recently that he may have had?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think at home at least, uh, but maybe at school, like you never know who they are in contact with, so I'm wondering if he just picked it up somewhere from school.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, they're all wearing masks right now, but I don't know if he picked something something up from his classmates.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah for sure. OK, and then any travel to anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, we've been at home, haven't left even to go to like a different city, have been in London the whole time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, and who does he live with at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So he lives with myself and his dad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any siblings?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he's an only child.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any reason to believe you have old carpets, mold, asbestos, anything that could be triggering his symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: You know we don't have any pets. We don't have any like old carpets, it's a fairly new apartment, so I don't think any of that should be an issue.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, well, I think those are all the questions that I had for him. Anything that you wanted to add or anything that I missed today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I think those are everything I wanted to talk about but I just was wondering if he needs to get tested or like if there's anything we can do today for him.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so he does seem to be checking off some of the criteria for strep throat. So just to make sure, because he does have a score of right now at least three or four, or maybe even five, definitely over four, we can prescribe him some antibiotics. But we will do a rapid strep test first in the clinic here today just to rule out in or rule that out. If it comes back positive and I guess even if it isn't positive because he checked off a lot of the boxes for strep throat, we will give him a prescription for penicillin or amoxicillin for 10 days. And then you can take that if his symptoms don't go away in a day or two. Because his symptoms also overlap with COVID, we will. do a swab for that as well and you should hear back within 24 to 48 hours and then you should isolate for 14 days. Does that sound good?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, great thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
